definitions.definition: ( chiefly US , Canada , Australia ) A cucumber preserved in a solution , usually a brine or a vinegar syrup.
examples: A pickle goes well with a hamburger.

definitions.definition: ( often in the plural ) Any vegetable preserved in vinegar and consumed as relish .
( UK ) A sweet, vinegary pickled chutney popular in Britain .
The brine used for preserving food.
examples: This tub is filled with the pickle that we will put the small cucumbers into.
The climber found himself in a pickle when one of the rocks broke off.

definitions.definition: ( endearing ) A mildly mischievous loved one .

examples: Jones was caught in a pickle between second and third.

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) A children’s game with three participants that emulates a baseball rundown
examples: The boys played pickle in the front yard for an hour.

definitions.definition: ( slang ) A pipe for smoking methamphetamine .
examples: Load some shards in that pickle .

definitions.definition: ( metalworking ) A bath of dilute sulphuric or nitric acid, etc., to remove burnt sand, scale, rust, etc., from the surface of castings , or other articles of metal, or to brighten them or improve their colour.
In an optical landing system , the hand-held controller connected to the lens , or apparatus on which the lights are mounted.

definitions.definition: A kernel ; a grain (of salt, sugar, etc.)

A small or indefinite quantity or amount (of something); a little, a bit, a few. Usually in partitive construction, frequently without "of"; a single grain or kernel of wheat, barley, oats, sand or dust.

main_definition: ( Northern England , Scotland ) A kernel ; a grain (of salt, sugar, etc.)
secondary_definitions: ( Northern England , Scotland ) A small or indefinite quantity or amount (of something); a little, a bit, a few. Usually in partitive construction, frequently without "of"; a single grain or kernel of wheat, barley, oats, sand or dust.
